com.irit.smac.model

Class Snapshot

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.irit.smac.model.Snapshot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Snapshot
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Snapshot is used to model the current state of a set of agents and their relations. A Snaphost is then composed of a list of agents and a list of relations between those agents.
    Author:
    Nicolas Verstaevel - nicolas.verstaevel@irit.fr
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Snapshot

        public Snapshot()
        Construct a new empty Snapshot.

    • Method Detail

      • getEntityList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entity> getEntityList()
        Get the agent list.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the agents. May be empty if there is no agent on the Snapshot.

      • getRelations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Relation> getRelations()
        Get the agents relations.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the agent relation. May be empty if there is no relation on the Snapshot.

      • addEntity

        public Entity addEntity(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String type)
        Add a new agent to the Snapshot.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the agent. Must be unique.
        type - The type of the agent (used to determine its css class).
        Returns:
        A reference to the newly created entity.

      • containsEntity

        public boolean containsEntity(java.lang.String name)
        Test if an agent in the agent list has the name passed in parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the agent to seek for.
        Returns:
        True if an agent is found, false otherwise.

      • containsRelation

        public boolean containsRelation(java.lang.String name)
        Test if an agent in the agent list has the name passed in parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the agent to seek for.
        Returns:
        True if an agent is found, false otherwise.

      • getEntity

        public Entity getEntity(java.lang.String A)
        Return a reference to an agent found by its name.
        Parameters:
        A - The name of the agent.
        Returns:
        A reference to the agent. May be null if no agent has been found.

      • addRelation

        public Relation addRelation(java.lang.String A,
                            java.lang.String B,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            boolean isDirectional,
                            java.lang.String type)
        Add a new relation between two agents in the Snapshot.
        Parameters:
        A - The name of the first agent.
        B - The name of the second agent.
        name - The name of the relation (must be unique).
        isDirectional - True if the relation is directional (from A to B), false if the relation is bidirectional (A--B).
        type - The type of the relation (used to determine its class in the css).
        Returns:
        A reference to the newly created relation.

      • getRelation

        public Relation getRelation(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Return a relation found by its name.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The name of the relation to seek for.
        Returns:
        A reference to the relation. May be null if no agent has been found.
